discussion.content:
I got this one wrong, initially I though A would suffice. It is indeed C (Full Migration). Ensure accessibility makes sure the workload can run however, it becomes non compliant with the policy (from https://blogs.vmware.com/virtualblocks/2018/10/29/a-closer-look-at-emm/#:~:text=Full%20Data%20Migration%20–%20evacuate%20all,with%20the%20respective%20storage%20policies)

Full Data Migration – evacuate all of the components to other hosts in the cluster. Ensure Accessibility – evacuate enough components to ensure that virtual machines can continue to run, but non-compliant with the respective storage policies.

The correct answer is C.
The host is going to be removed from the cluster permanently.

questions.question_text: Which vSAN maintenance mode option should be used to avoid storage policy non-compliance?

discussion.content:
B: if you do not explicitly assign a storage policy to the virtual machine the vSAN Default Storage Policy is assigned to the virtual machine.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere.vsan.doc/GUID-C228168F-6807-4C2A-9D74-E584CAF49A2A.html

Selected Answer: B
B - Correct

choices.D: No data protection will be applied to the VM objects.
choices.C: The vSphere Web Client will choose the last vSAN Storage Policy used.
choices.B: The VM objects will be protected based on the vSAN Default Storage Policy configurations.

questions.question_text:
vSAN requires that the virtual machines deployed on the vSAN datastores are assigned at least one storage policy, but the administrator did not explicitly assign a storage policy when provisioning the new VM.
What is the result of this situation?

discussion.content:
Correct Answer is A&E 

Starting with vSphere 7.0 Update 3, you can use vSphere Lifecycle Manager images to manage a vSAN stretched cluster and its witness host. The following requirements exist:
vCenter Server must be version 7.0 Update 3 and later.
The witness host must be ESXi version 7.0 Update 2 and later.
The witness host must be a virtual server and not a physical server.
The witness host must be a dedicated witness host and not a shared witness host.

comments.content: Typo in the answer choice earlier - Correct Answer is A&D

discussion.content: A and D is correct anwers

Selected Answer: AD
A D. To use images, the witness cannot be physical or shared. It must be dedicated or virtual appliance. https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere-lifecycle-manager.doc/GUID-F84F1FC8-FBA8-4E4E-845F-40F423CBEEC8.html

A & D are correct
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere-lifecycle-manager.doc/GUID-F84F1FC8-FBA8-4E4E-845F-40F423CBEEC8.html

Selected Answer: AD
vLCM can monitor and upgrade vSAN stretched and Two-Node clusters. vCLM has the following features for stretched and Two-Node clusters:
• Supports the lifecycle of a witness appliance
• Performs witness node upgrade first, then upgrades the rest of the cluster
• Supports witness node appliances only (physical witness host not supported)
• Supports dedicated witness node, does not support shared witness node

vLCM can monitor and upgrade vSAN stretched and Two-Node clusters. vCLM has the following features for stretched and Two-Node clusters:
• Supports the lifecycle of a witness appliance
• Performs witness node upgrade first, then upgrades the rest of the cluster
• Supports witness node appliances only (physical witness host not supported)
• Supports dedicated witness node, does not support shared witness node

Selected Answer: AE
A vSAN Witness Appliance, or a physical host, can be used for the Witness function. The vSAN Witness Appliance includes licensing, while a physical host must be licensed accordingly.

https://infohub.delltechnologies.com/l/planning-guide-dell-emc-vxrail-7-0-vsan-stretched-cluster-1/witness-host-5/

comments.content:
Correction - Answer is A and D 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere-lifecycle-manager.doc/GUID-F84F1FC8-FBA8-4E4E-845F-40F423CBEEC8.html

To remediate the witness host against the vSphere Lifecycle Manager cluster image, the following requirements exist:
vCenter Server must be version 7.0 Update 3 and later.
The witness host must be ESXi version 7.0 Update 2 and later.
The witness host must be a virtual server and not a physical server.
The witness host must be a dedicated witness host and not a shared witness host.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is upgrading multiple vSAN Witness nodes with vLCM (single image management) that are used for vSAN Stretched and two-node Clusters.
What two witness node types can the administrator upgrade? (Choose two.)

A vSAN administrator notices that the VMware Skyline Health: Network Latency Check reports indicate that three hosts are noncompliant.
Which action should the vSAN administrator take?

choices.B: Check VMKNICs, uplinks, physical switches, and associated settings
choices.C: Rerun the VMware Skyline Health: vSAN Cluster Partition report
choices.D: Place the non-compliant hosts into an isolated network partition

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B:
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2149511

D) Backend
Pg 30.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vsan-703-monitoring-troubleshooting-guide.pdf

Also confirmed in vCenter at work.
"Latency" is a graph / metric under Backend.
D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Disk and host network performance categories are only visible at a host-level, not at the cluster level.
There is no "resync latency" category : this is a simple metric.
The right answer is D : Backend. Once you go in Monitor / vSAN / Performance / Backend, you can see all the resync metrics : Resync Read IOPS, Resync Read Throughput, Resync Read Latency

Selected Answer: C
When a vSAN administrator wants to view resynchronizing metrics and is concerned about the duration of resynchronization processes, they should open the "Resync Latency" performance category.

Resync latency metrics provide information about the time it takes for vSAN to synchronize objects within the cluster. Monitoring this category helps administrators understand the efficiency of resynchronization processes and identify potential issues that might be causing delays.

So, the correct option is:

C. Resync Latency

Selected Answer: D
D. https://core.vmware.com/resource/troubleshooting-vsan-performance#_Toc536646871

Selected Answer: D
https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/vmware/view/74593-exam-5v0-2221-topic-1-question-5-discussion/
D - Backend

For me, "C" is the correct answer, not "D". The question is focused on checking specifically the resynchronization metrics, and the answer "Resynchronization Latency" is, by far, much related to the question than the other answers, which are more "general".

questions.question_text:
A vSAN administrator is noticing that the objects resynchronizing in the cluster are taking longer than expected and wants to view the resynchronizing metrics.
Which performance category should the vSAN administrator open?
